summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute check sheets for the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated July 8, 2019. The sheets are for different tiers (G, H, I, J, K) and document staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, requiring checks at least twice per hour. The sheets are reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain.

events.title: Daily inmate observation checks
events.description: Routine 30-minute observation checks of inmates in the Special Housing Unit at MCC New York were conducted throughout the day and night, as documented on multiple check sheets.

keyFacts: The document is a set of prison log sheets from the MCC New York Special Housing Unit dated July 8, 2019.
It details a strict observation protocol requiring inmates in locked-down status to be visually checked at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are for multiple tiers (G, H, I, J, K) within the SHU, indicating a multi-cell unit.
Each sheet is reviewed and signed off by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, showing a chain of accountability.
The document is a standard correctional facility operational record, showing routine inmate monitoring procedures.
